comments.text:
Created attachment 8971138
ff_blured_html_and_snapshot.zip

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0
Build ID: 20180423171039

Steps to reproduce:

Open html file in FF


Actual results:

Letters on button "Выбрать другой" like blured.


Expected results:

Letters on button "Выбрать другой" must be normal like in other browsers.
comments.author: phpinfo12345@gmail.com

comments.text:
Testcase doesn't work. It's full of missing content.

Please provide the exact steps to reproduce the issue.

1. http://kabuki-sp.ru
2. Add 1200+ worth of items to the basket.
3. http://kabuki-sp.ru/gifts — I don't see the green image with the red button pictured in the screenshot.
comments.author: gingerbread_man@live.com

comments.text:
(In reply to Gingerbread Man from comment #2)
> Testcase doesn't work. It's full of missing content.
> 
> Please provide the exact steps to reproduce the issue.
> 
> 1. http://kabuki-sp.ru
> 2. Add 1200+ worth of items to the basket.
> 3. http://kabuki-sp.ru/gifts — I don't see the green image with the red
> button pictured in the screenshot.

You have to click on button with text "Выбрать".
The most simple way to reproduce this issue is open provided html in the attachment https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8971138 (contains .html and screenshot)

Anyway, resolution of your monitor must be 1920x1080.
comments.author: phpinfo12345@gmail.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 8971475
gifts_page.png

(In reply to phpinfo12345 from comment #3)
> You have to click on button with text "Выбрать".

You mean click the little red present icon on the right side of the page, then click Выбрать. That just brings me to http://kabuki-sp.ru/gifts which like I said, doesn't feature the green image with the red button pictured in your screenshot. See my attached screenshot.
comments.author: gingerbread_man@live.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 8971476
attached_html.png

(In reply to phpinfo12345 from comment #3)
> The most simple way to reproduce this issue is open provided html in the
> attachment https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8971138 (contains
> .html and screenshot)

Like I said, the attached HTML page is unusable. See this screenshot.
comments.author: gingerbread_man@live.com

comments.text:
Created attachment 8971490
ff_blured_html.zip contains right html with resources

This zip archive contains html and folder with resources (like css and images).
comments.author: phpinfo12345@gmail.com

comments.text:
I could reproduce the problem on one win10 PC.

With mozregression, the regression window was narrowed down to [2012-12-29, 2012-12-30]. 

 1:30.86 INFO: Narrowed nightly regression window from [2012-12-28, 2012-12-30] (2 days) to [2012-12-29, 2012-12-30] (1 days) (~0 steps left)
 1:30.88 INFO: Got as far as we can go bisecting nightlies...
 1:30.88 INFO: Last good revision: 0bb4773db082 (2012-12-29)
 1:30.88 INFO: First bad revision: eb2f5c66561b (2012-12-30)
 1:30.88 INFO: Pushlog:
http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=0bb4773db082&tochange=eb2f5c66561b


But it could not narrowed down to more details. mozregression emitted error logs like "Unable to find build info using the taskcluster".
comments.author: sotaro.ikeda.g@gmail.com

comments.text: :jfkthame, can you comment to the bug?
comments.author: sotaro.ikeda.g@gmail.com

comments.text:
I can't seem to reproduce this locally; the font looks OK on my Windows machine. But from the screenshot, it looks like the antialiasing of the white-on-red text at that particular font size is leaving it rather washed-out. This may be dependent on local font smoothing settings, and may also depend on the Windows display scaling setting (as that will affect the actual device-pixel font size that is used for a given CSS px size).

I guess other factors such as graphics drivers might also be playing a part?

Attaching the Graphics data from about:support on a system that shows this might help identify the key elements.
comments.author: jfkthame@gmail.com

comments.text:
(In reply to Jonathan Kew (:jfkthame) from comment #10)
> I can't seem to reproduce this locally; the font looks OK on my Windows
> machine. But from the screenshot, it looks like the antialiasing of the
> white-on-red text at that particular font size is leaving it rather
> washed-out. This may be dependent on local font smoothing settings, and may
> also depend on the Windows display scaling setting (as that will affect the
> actual device-pixel font size that is used for a given CSS px size).
> 
> I guess other factors such as graphics drivers might also be playing a part?
> 
> Attaching the Graphics data from about:support on a system that shows this
> might help identify the key elements.
